newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila bourse mulls rule to stop backdoor listing.
newsitem.headline: Manila bourse mulls rule to stop backdoor listing.

text.p: The Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE) has drafted rules that will discourage backdoor listing, said a memorandum submitted to the Department of Finance on Wednesday.
Securities and Exchange Commission chairman Perfecto Yasay, who gave the memorandum, told reporters the new rules may take effect in September.

Backdoor listing refers to the practice of buying or taking over shares of a listed but dormant company to activate trading of the shares to raise funds without going through the cumbersome process of registration.

Under the proposed guidelines, trading of shares of a company that is the subject of backdoor listing will be automatically suspended and additional listings must comply with all rules covering initial public offering applications.
"This will eliminate the process of backdoor listing. This will level the playing field," Yasay said.
